documentation.text:
@title Mining NFT tokens and introducing rarity
 @author Robbe Louwet
 
a tier is unique as well as its mask
a tier's mask is the amount of trailing 1's, it signifies the odds of mining that tier
e.g. mask of 111 (or "3" -> 2^3 - 1) tells that there is a 1/7 chance to mine this tier (!= odds to mine an item in this tier)
tier             => challenge mask               -> odds
"normal"         => ?                            -> 93% (1 - all other odds)
"common"         => 0xF      OR           1111   -> 1/15
"uncommon"       => 0x1F     OR         1 1111   -> 1/31
"Legendary"      => 0x3F     OR       111 1111   -> 1/127
"Exotic"         => 0xFF     OR      1111 1111   -> 1/255

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(uint256 => struct CollectibleUtils.ItemBlueprint storage ref[] storage ref)
struct CollectibleUtils.ItemBlueprint storage ref[] storage ref
literal_string "There is no such blueprint in this tier!"

arguments.value: There is no such blueprint in this tier!

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "There is no such blueprint in this tier!"

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(uint256 => struct CollectibleUtils.ItemBlueprint storage ref[] storage ref)
struct CollectibleUtils.ItemBlueprint storage ref[] storage ref

documentation.text:
the total oods will be 1 out of 2^(exponent) - 1
 so if exponent is 3, the total odds of mining this tier is 2^3 - 1 = 1 out of 7

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Please specify a number between 0 and 256"
